Semigroup in lp
Let \(\mathcal{L}\) be an essentially self-adjoint operator with respect to the \(\sigma\)-finite measure \(\mu\) of the measurable space \((E, \mathcal{F})\). By spectral theory, \(\mathcal{L}\) is uniquely associated with a self-adjoint strongly continuous contraction semigroup \((P_t)_{t \in \mathbb{R}_+}\) on \(L^2(E,\mu)\)... See more
